alert.note: Alert for Greene; Oconee; Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 1:53PM EST until January 28 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Penfield affecting Greene, Oglethorpe and Oconee Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the Georgia Highway 15 bridge. The right bank begins to overflow into agricultural land and pastures with a foot or two of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 9.5 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 13.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning to 12.7 feet tomorrow evening. It will rise above flood stage again late tomorrow evening to 13.9 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage again early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 13 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM EST.
